content.p: A placement is time spent in a workplace, doing supervised work, during your studies or shortly after graduation. You might see placements advertised as ‘internships’, ‘work experience’, or ‘volunteering’, as different organisations use different terms. What’s most important is that you choose an opportunity that interests you, and will help you develop skills future employers value. I wouldn’t have secured either of my internships without the experience I gained from the Digital Marketing Academy and the support of the Careers and Employability Service. Olivia Taylor Theology and Religious Studies graduate Learn more about the types of placements available Discover the placement programmes Discover our placement programmes Discover the practice placement options Please note the above list of subject specific opportunties is a sample of placements we offer at the University of Nottingham. If you would like to find out if your course has a placement option, please visit your dedicated course page in our prosepctus, or make an enquiry with out team. Placements Widening participation Imagine and create your future. Join our programmes to take part in activities to inspire, support and inform your higher education experience. Don’t let your background determine your destination – write your own story. Nottingham and Nottinghamshire Here are the "hidden gems" students should know about when visiting Nottingham. Many of our students complete placements with a wide range of industry partners. Hear from some of those students and read their experiences.
